bug.author: rcurtin
bug.summary: Python binding warnings are inaccurate or misleading
bug.description:
The warnings in bindings to other languages are generally written for command-line programs; example: <denchmark-code>>>> o = logistic_regression(training=x, labels=y, lambda_=0.5) [WARN ] --output_file ignored because --test_file is not specified. [WARN ] --output_probabilities_file ignored because --test_file is not specified. </denchmark-code>
but neither of those warnings make very much sense. We need a way to write generic error or warning messages that can be automatically reformatted for the language at hand.
